text: Australia competed at the 1984 Winter Olympics in Sarajevo, Yugoslavia. Eleven athletes participated, competing in alpine skiing, biathlon, cross-country skiing, figure skating and speed skating. Australia's best result was 19th in downhill skiing by Steven Lee. This was the first Olympics in which Australia competed in biathlon. ==Alpine skiing== ;Men {|class="wikitable" style="font- size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="6"|Final |- !Run 1 !Rank !Run 2 !Rank !Total !Rank |- |-align="center" |align="left" rowspan=2|Steven Lee |align="left" |Downhill |colspan=4 |1:48.02 |19 |-align="center" |align="left" |Giant slalom |1:28.76 |36 |colspan=4|Disqualified |-align="center" |align="left"|Alistair Guss |align="left" |Downhill |colspan=4 |1:50.57 |34 |} ;Women {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="6"|Final |- !Run 1 !Rank !Run 2 !Rank !Total !Rank |- |-align="center" |align="left"|Marilla Guss |align="left" |Downhill |colspan=4 |1:19.75 |28 |} ==Biathlon== ;Men {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="3"|Final |- !Time !Misses !Rank |-align="center" |align="left" rowspan=2|Andrew Paul |align="left"|Individual |1:26:38.7 |5 |47 |-align="center" |align="left"|Sprint |36:32.4 |3 |50 |} ==Cross-country skiing== ;Men {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Race |- !Time !Rank |-align="center" |align="left" rowspan=3|Chris Allen |align="left"|15 km |49:14.5 |64 |-align="center" |align="left"|30 km |1:45:07.7 |59 |-align="center" |align="left"|50 km |2:44:19.1 |49 |-align="center" |align="left" rowspan=3|David Hislop |align="left"|15 km |47:25.5 |59 |-align="center" |align="left"|30 km |1:43:46.2 |57 |-align="center" |align="left"|50 km |2:39:53.1 |48 |} ==Figure skating== {|class="wikitable" style="font- size:90%" |- !
